projects.title: Treasure Hunter
projects.description: Treasure Hunter is a 2D platformer where your objective is to find a way to reach the treasure chest. The game features 30 levels full of challenges. While creating this game, I learned a lot about Unity, and I’m proud to have finally published the project on Google Play and itch.io.

projects.title: Datenshi: Reborn
projects.description: Datenshi: Reborn is a 2.5D platformer with RPG elements, developed for Nintendo Switch and PC. During the development of the game, I created a system for playing and managing music and sound effects. I was also responsible for level design and scripting levels. Additionally, I worked on creating dialogue scenes.

projects.title: Aidar.Skills - Editor
projects.description:
In the Aidar.Skills project—a VR training-editor—I played a key role in implementing a wide range of core systems.
I was responsible for: defining the overall system architecture and designing its modular components, implementing server communication via a REST API, loading and managing 3D models in GLB format fetched dynamically from the server, integrating and executing Lua scripts for runtime customization, and many other features essential to the editor’s functionality and extensibility.

projects.title: Aidar.Skills - Player
projects.description: Aidar.Skills – Player is another core component of the Aidar.Skills system. Just like with the editor, I played a significant role in this project. I was responsible for implementing a wide range of VR training mechanics. I developed VR training scenarios for various clients, tailoring each to their specific needs. In addition, I led the migration of the project from SteamVR to OpenXR and performed extensive optimization to ensure smooth performance on devices such as Meta Quest, HTC Focus, and Pico headsets. I also created a prototype version of the Player for the Apple Vision Pro headset.

projects.title: The Witcher 3: Halloween at Crossroads Inn
projects.description: Halloween at Crossroads Inn is a simple mod for The Witcher 3 that I created for one of the competitions organized by CD Projekt RED to celebrate the release of REDkit. The mod was selected as one of the winners of the third challenge (Fall is coming). The main goal of the project was to transform the lighting and environment of the Witcher world to give it a more autumnal atmosphere. Additionally, I introduced Halloween-themed elements into the game world to further enhance the seasonal mood.

projects.title: The Witcher 3: The Price Of Neutrality Remastered
projects.description: The Price of Neutrality Remastered is a mod for The Witcher 3 that brings the entire story of the original The Price of Neutrality—originally released for The Witcher 1—into the newer game. For this project, I implemented all the quests featured in the original version. I also modified the Kaer Morhen map to closely resemble its original layout. In addition, I integrated music from The Witcher 1 into The Witcher 3. I created all dialogue scenes and cutscenes from scratch. A significant amount of scripting was also involved—for example, the mod can be launched directly via a custom button in the game’s main menu. The project turned out to be much larger than I initially expected, and its development took a considerable amount of time.
